title: "Ask Riot: URF"

replies.body:
I mean, i'm pretty sure a lot of the people who have left, were the people who would come back if URF came back in a REAL form, and come play that and only that.

The drop in players wasn't URF, it was people realizing that, yeah league is kinda shit, and being fed up with it.

Hell i think we all know that feeling at this point, and i feel riot don't really understand how to remedy that even in their own area's.

I think the problem for Riot is that to remedy the game, they will have to dial it back a few notches, and doing so will be a shock for a lot of people _(imagine if your Q didn't half health people??! Unthinkable! O_o)_. 

and they are scared of that change period and the players that might lose interest in a less fast-pased kill-focused game.
But tbh, I don't see any option other than a forced dial back, yes you might lose some players, but you're going to lose a lot more if the game continues down its current path, and loyal players too.

I think Riot need to be thinking long-term and get out of this short-term view they have currently. 
If they fix the game now, they WILL lose players, that is inevitable, but the game will live on and more players will join each year. 
if they don't fix the game, in all sad truthfulness, it may only have several seasons left in it before enough people get fed up and go that even if they do fix the game later down the track, there might not be enough people left to keep it afloat.

I mean, i hate assassin meta's and haven't even been playing that much (have been playing closers this past week) because i'm sick of it, i play games like League for the competitive aspect, and it doesn't feel competitive to one shot everything, because there is very little skill involved in that.

Pretty sure some people even said they only play League for URF so when they started doing shitty ARURF people stopped playing league for good because of THAT. It really shows how inaccurate their info is when it's obvious the percentage of players who ACTUALLY quit the game for good was so minimal compared to the extremely large portion of players who still play the game who want normal URF back. Most the the players they say "stopped playing league" were obviously people taking a long break after playing so many games of URF.
